summary: A brief email from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Office of the Deputy Attorney General, requesting time to discuss the Epstein case. This indicates coordination between federal prosecutors regarding the investigation.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: Author of an email requesting a discussion about the Epstein case with the Office of the Deputy Attorney General.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at SDNY reached out to the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) to discuss the Epstein case in May 2019.
The communication indicates ongoing high-level coordination between federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation.
The email is brief and professional, suggesting a scheduled discussion about case matters.
